name: Gluten-Free Italian Meatballs
author: gobomel
summary: I have to cook gluten-free for some family members who love Italian food, but cannot tolerate the gluten. I have re-vamped my recipes so they can enjoy good food with the rest of the family. Even if you are not GF, you will still enjoy these meatballs. They are delicious!!
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) jar tomato sauce, or as needed
directions: Beat milk and egg together in a large bowl
Mix bread crumbs in until a paste forms
Add ground beef, onion, garlic, and parsley, and mix with your hands until just combined
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray
Measure meatballs using an ice cream scoop

Roll balls with dampened hands and place on the prepared baking sheet Bake in the preheated oven until meatballs are no longer pink in the center and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 30 minutes
While meatballs bake, heat tomato sauce in saucepan over medium heat
Add baked meatballs to the sauce and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes
